column4: hey guys, I urgently need some help. I got a new HD last week and set up 3 partitions: one for windows, one for ubuntu, and one for storage.  i installed windows, installed ubuntu, everythign was fine.  after tinkering with Ubu for a while, I realized I didn't really care much for it and decided to delete the partition and add that unallocated space to my windows partition.  now i cant boot into windows.. grub error 17
i somehow just need to get rid of grub entirely and get my system thinking windows is my only OS again
you need to reinstall the windows mbr instead of grub. this is done by booting the windows install cd, getting recovery console and run fixmbr.
